item.title: Introduction
item.description: Fir is a toolkit to build server-rendered HTML apps and progressively enhance them to enable real-time user experiences. The toolkit is meant for developers who want to build real-time web apps using Go, server-rendered HTML(html/template), CSS and sprinkles of declarative javascript(alpine.js). It can be used to build: static websites like a landing page or a blog, interactive CRUD apps like ticket helpdesks, real-time apps like metrics dashboards or social media streams.

item.title: FAQs
item.description: A Go toolkit to build reactive web interfaces. Why does it exist ? # Wants to provide a way to build moderately complex reactive apps for folks who are comfortable with Go. The library is a result of a series of experiments to build reactive apps in Go: gomodest-template. It works by patching the DOM on user events using morphdom. What is it ? # Its a toolkit: a Go library, a CLI and an alpine.
